content.description:
A very dirty start on sandy holds leads to a slightly better headwall featuring fingery, technical moves.

Gently make your way up 25 feet of crumbly, fragile rock to the base of a slightly overhanging wall.  Stepping off the ledge you encounter the crux on thin pockets and crimps.  Better holds but bigger pulls lead to the anchors.

Not a terrible route but not worth doing unless you have exhausted other options and don't mind some choss at the start.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Third route from the rights side of the Bright Side. Look for a large hueco at the start and a big tree growing near the wall.

content.description: fun climbing to interesting boulder problem near the anchors
content.location: farthest line away from approach trail around the corner.  high first bolt

content.description: Short route with one hard move that is very height dependent. Lots of fun!
kinda dirty start to fun climbing
content.location: the second route you pass from the approach trail(the first one is easy to miss).

content.description: Hard start on painful rock to easier climbing.

climbs.name: Medicine Man
climbs.fa: Enzo Oddo, equipped by Kipp Trummel

content.description: Nice route with a heinous crux section midway up.
content.location: Just left of Crown of Thorns, look for the small glue-in bolts and obvious thin crux at mid-height.

content.description: An easy start takes you to a no-hands stance beneath the orange headwall. Launch up the wall into sustained overhanging moves and a techy vertical crux. A chicken bolt added in 2015 has eased the somewhat spicy crux moves, although the new bolt is a bit strenuous to clip and can be skipped. The fall is clean, but don't push hard away from the wall with a bunch of slack out, as the tree lurks below.
content.location: Left of the two golden streak/vert-headwall routes beneath the enormous arch on the right margin of the Bright Side. The right gold streak route is Fresh Baked (12b).

content.description: Easy start leads to bouldery steep moves out the headwall and a stout crimpy crux on the vertical face above.
content.location: Just right of Golden Brown, the rightmost of the two orange streak routes beneath the huge arch formation on the right edge of the Bright Side.

content.description: Physical chimney to a cruxy thin lieback to more physical chimneying. Take a spider wand in summer... hence the name. Best to clean this one on toprope and rap from the anchor.
content.protection: Some big cams helpful, finger-sized for the crux. 2 bolt anchor pretty much up as high as you can get inside the arch.
content.location: The obvious corner system on the right edge of the Bright Side, accessed via the rebar ladder up to the ledge system.

content.description: A tough boulder problem low followed by a few no-hands rests and a phenomenal redpoint crux on the golden upper headwall.
content.location: Right side of the main Bright Side overhanging amphitheater, between two open projects and two lines left of Medicine Man. Goes to the top of the wall and starts roughly behind a large tree off a nice boulder.

content.description: Cool bouldery climbing up a nice orange streak followed by a lichen crossing and then more cool bouldery climbing up a vertical black streak.
content.location: Right margin of the wall beneath the big arch at the Bright Side, start up high off a ledge accessed by the rebar ladder. Leftmost of these ledge routes, just left of the big chimney/corner system (Epigyne 5.8+).

content.description: Bouldery climbing below and left of a big hueco leads to a no-hands rest. Find hidden holds above the hueco and launch out left, cool and sustained moves up the headwall are followed by a "quintessentially-RRG" match in a hand-sized hueco. An endurance crux guards the anchor.
content.location: Center of the Bright Side, just right of the steeper amphitheater and the thinner Medicine Man (5.13 with glue-in bolts), directly behind a large boulder.

content.description: Short and rather chossy climb with a small roof in the middle.
new route slightly dirty rock, bunches of fun
content.location: second route farthest from approach trail

content.description: Bouldery crux down low followed by stellar jug hauling and a redpoint crux high on the wildly overhanging wall. Best not to enter the big hueco up high but rather hand-heel traverse along the edge, as the rock inside is sandy choss. The route is pretty much in the bag at that point anyway.
content.location: Far left route on the Bright Side's main super steep amphitheater, just left of Better Eat Yo' Wheatleys (13-).

content.description: Fairly casual climbing leads to the hueco shared with Crown of Thorns. Sustained crimping reaches a peak near the chains.

climbs.name: Blowin' Loadz
climbs.fa: Frank Byron, equipped by Dustin Stephens

content.description: Three cruxes separated by big jugs. The top crux is a classic heartbreaker with awesome moves.
content.location: Center of the Bright Side's main overhanging amphitheater, with the most obvious-looking flake start. Stops at the midway horizontal break, although it is possible to traverse over and finish on the top section of Skywalker (13b) for a nice 12d linkup.

climbs.name: Better Eat Yo' Wheatleys
climbs.fa: Adam Taylor, equipped by Andrew Wheatley

content.description: More hard bouldery pumpy climbing, with radical crux moves on the orange and black headwall up top.
content.location: 2nd from left on the main overhanging amphitheater of the Bright Side, right of Bush League and left of Blowin' Loadz. Does not have fixed steel draws at this time.
